courses.title: Introduction to Computer Science
courses.description: An introduction to computer science and programming using Python. Topics include variables, control structures, functions, and basic algorithms.

courses.title: Data Structures and Algorithms
courses.description: Study of fundamental data structures including arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, and graphs. Algorithm analysis and design techniques.

courses.title: Object-Oriented Programming
courses.description: Introduction to object-oriented programming concepts using Java. Classes, objects, inheritance, polymorphism, and encapsulation.

courses.title: Computer Organization
courses.description: Introduction to computer organization and architecture. Machine language, assembly language, CPU design, and memory systems.

courses.title: Database Systems
courses.description: Introduction to database design and implementation. SQL, relational database theory, and database management systems.

courses.title: Software Engineering
courses.description: Software development methodologies, project management, testing, and quality assurance. Team-based software development.

courses.title: Operating Systems
courses.description: Study of operating system concepts including process management, memory management, file systems, and concurrency.

courses.title: Computer Networks
courses.description: Network protocols, TCP/IP, network security, and distributed systems. Hands-on experience with network programming.

courses.title: Calculus I
courses.description: Introduction to differential calculus. Limits, derivatives, and applications of derivatives.

courses.title: Calculus II
courses.description: Introduction to integral calculus. Integration techniques and applications of integrals.

courses.title: Calculus III
courses.description: Multivariable calculus. Partial derivatives, multiple integrals, and vector calculus.

courses.title: Linear Algebra
courses.description: Vector spaces, linear transformations, eigenvalues, and eigenvectors. Applications to various fields.

courses.title: Abstract Algebra
courses.description: Introduction to groups, rings, and fields. Proof techniques and algebraic structures.

courses.title: Real Analysis
courses.description: Rigorous treatment of real numbers, sequences, series, continuity, and differentiability.

courses.title: Principles of Economics
courses.description: Introduction to microeconomics and macroeconomics. Supply and demand, market structures, and economic policy.

courses.title: Intermediate Microeconomics
courses.description: Advanced microeconomic theory including consumer choice, producer theory, and market equilibrium.

courses.title: Intermediate Macroeconomics
courses.description: Advanced macroeconomic theory including economic growth, business cycles, and monetary policy.

courses.title: Econometrics
courses.description: Statistical methods for economic analysis. Regression analysis and hypothesis testing.

courses.title: General Biology I
courses.description: Introduction to cellular biology, genetics, and molecular biology. Laboratory component included.

courses.title: General Biology II
courses.description: Introduction to ecology, evolution, and organismal biology. Laboratory component included.

courses.title: Introduction to Literature
courses.description: Critical reading and analysis of poetry, drama, and fiction. Introduction to literary criticism.

courses.title: British Literature
courses.description: Survey of British literature from the medieval period to the present.

courses.title: American Literature
courses.description: Survey of American literature from colonial times to the present.
